channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What does it mean when the president calls to "nationalize the voting"?
item.description: Wendy Weiser, the vice president for democracy at the Brennan Center for Justice, discusses the impact of President Trump's recent urging of Republicans to "nationalize" voting.
item.content:encoded: Wendy Weiser, the vice president for democracy at the Brennan Center for Justice, discusses the impact of President Trump's recent urging of Republicans to "nationalize" voting.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: Temperature check by voters in Minnesota
item.description: In the first electoral temperature check in Minnesota since President Trump launched Operation Metro Surge to ramp up immigration enforcement in the state, voters had a lot to say.
item.content:encoded: In the first electoral temperature check in Minnesota since President Trump launched Operation Metro Surge to ramp up immigration enforcement in the state, voters had a lot to say.
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: Suicide bombing at Islamabad mosque kills 31 people
item.description: An update on the suicide bombing in Pakistan's capital that killed 31 people.
item.content:encoded: An update on the suicide bombing in Pakistan's capital that killed 31 people.
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: Among U.S.-Iran tensions, concern for an Iranian-American in Evin prison
item.description: As indirect talks begin between the U.S. and Iran over that country's nuclear program, Ryan Fayhee, lawyer for journalist Abdolreza Valizadeh, talks about his concern for his client, who is being held in Evin prison in Tehran.
item.content:encoded: As indirect talks begin between the U.S. and Iran over that country's nuclear program, Ryan Fayhee, lawyer for journalist Abdolreza Valizadeh, talks about his concern for his client, who is being held in Evin prison in Tehran.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: Danish vets want an apology from President Trump
item.description: Danish veterans of the war in Iraq want an apology from Trump over Greenland stance.
item.content:encoded: Danish veterans of the war in Iraq want an apology from Trump over Greenland stance.
item.dc:creator: Adrienne Murray

item.title: Red White and Blaine remembers Catherine O'Hara
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: The thrill of attending the opening ceremony at the 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Rachel Goes to the Games newsletter writer recounts the thrill of attending an Olympics opening ceremony for the first time.
item.content:encoded: Rachel Goes to the Games newsletter writer recounts the thrill of attending an Olympics opening ceremony for the first time.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: How one content creator's Dr. Pepper jingle grabbed the attention of the Internet â€” and brands
item.description: NPR's Mia Venkat explains what the internet was obsessed with this week: the jazzy jingles made by content creator Romeo.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mia Venkat explains what the internet was obsessed with this week: the jazzy jingles made by content creator Romeo.
item.dc:creator: Mia Venkat

item.title: Covering the immigration surge in Minneapolis as a local
item.description: Meg Anderson, who has been reporting on the Trump administration's immigration campaign in Minneapolis, talks about what it is like to cover a national event in her home town.
item.content:encoded: Meg Anderson, who has been reporting on the Trump administration's immigration campaign in Minneapolis, talks about what it is like to cover a national event in her home town.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: Seahawks vs. Patriots: The Super Bowl rematch no one expected when the season began
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Nora Princiotti of The Ringer to preview this year's Super Bowl matchup between Seattle and New England.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Nora Princiotti of The Ringer to preview this year's Super Bowl matchup between Seattle and New England.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers
